alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:51PM EDT until September 08 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL WARREN...SOUTH CENTRAL MONROE AND NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 551 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near East Bangor, or 11 miles north of Easton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Belfast, East Bangor, Stormville, Roxburg, Columbia, Stroudsburg, Roseto, Portland and Arlington Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 308 and 310. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 4 and 5. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
